circumstances: Following an uneventful bombing mission over Rabaul, the crew was returning to his base in Port Moresby when he encountered technical problems en route. The captain decided to reduce his altitude in an attempt to make an emergency landing. The aircraft crash landed in a marshy field and slid for several yards before coming to rest. While all eight occupants were unhurt, the aircraft was damaged beyond repair. It was recovered in 2006 and later convoyed to the US.
